snippet: Before Brussels, a wave of terror attacks whipped through Turkey, the Ivory Coast, Yemen and elsewhere. But these events appeared to garner less international attention. We went there, and asked why....
lead_paragraph: Before Brussels, a wave of terror attacks whipped through Turkey, the Ivory Coast, Yemen and elsewhere. But these events appeared to garner less international attention. We went there, and asked why.

byline.original: By DAN RUETENIK and MARGARET CHEATHAM WILLIAMS

headline.print_headline: French Ask Why Priest’s Killer, Listed as a Threat, Was Able to Strike
headline.main: French Ask Whether Priest’s Killer, Listed as a Threat, Could Have Been Stopped

snippet: Adel Kermiche, 19, had spent nearly 10 months in detention but was released in March over prosecutors’ objections....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Many French citizens are questioning whether killing of Roman Catholic priest Jacques Hamel in Normandy, by teenager who was well known to counterterrorism authorities, could have been prevented.
lead_paragraph: Adel Kermiche, 19, had spent nearly 10 months in detention but was released in March over prosecutors’ objections.

byline.contributor: Lilia Blaise and Martin de Bourmont contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and ADAM NOSSITER

headline.print_headline: A Misguided War, the Untold Dead
headline.main: Chilcot Report: How Tony Blair Sold the War

snippet: The report condemns Britain’s reckless warmongers, yet omits the true cost — Iraq’s unnumbered dead....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Op-Ed article by Iraq expert Carne Ross argues British officials implicated in recent report concluding country erred gravely in 2003 invasion of Iraq should face more serious consequences than public ridicule; laments report's failure to mention emergence of Islamic State, scope of Iraqi casualties or to make recommendations for reparations.
lead_paragraph: The report condemns Britain’s reckless warmongers, yet omits the true cost — Iraq’s unnumbered dead.

headline.print_headline: Attackers Linked to Bangladesh Restaurant Slaughter Had Privileged Lives
headline.main: After Slaughter, Bangladesh Reels at Revelations About Attackers

snippet: The men tied to the bloody restaurant siege in Dhaka, all in their late teens and early 20s, were products of Bangladesh’s elite....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Residents of Dhaka, Bangladesh, express shock at learning six jihadists who butchered 20 people at Holey Artisan Bakery were children from elite local families; although authorities did not release their names, young men were identified from photos posted on Islamic State messaging app; many of perpetrators attended Scholastica School, top private institution in Dhaka, and had gone missing before violent incident.
lead_paragraph: The men tied to the bloody restaurant siege in Dhaka, all in their late teens and early 20s, were products of Bangladesh’s elite.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Geeta Anand from Mumbai, India.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and GEETA ANAND

headline.main: Lynch on Empathy and Inquiry in Orlando

lead_paragraph: Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch offered details into the investigation of the Orlando, Fla., shooting and expressed support for the L.G.B.T. community.

headline.main: Looking the Orlando Shooter in the Eyes

snippet: Tiara Parker, right, was trapped in a bathroom stall at the Pulse nightclub when she locked eyes with Omar Mateen, the gunman. She and her cousin Akyra Monet Murray were shot, and Ms. Murray died. Natalie Murray, left, Akyra's mother, recalled her...
lead_paragraph: Tiara Parker, right, was trapped in a bathroom stall at the Pulse nightclub when she locked eyes with Omar Mateen, the gunman. She and her cousin Akyra Monet Murray were shot, and Ms. Murray died. Natalie Murray, left, Akyra's mother, recalled her daughter's frantic phone call.

byline.original: By BRENT McDONALD and BEN LAFFIN

headline.print_headline: Bus Bombing in Jerusalem Reawakens Familiar Anxieties After Months of Violence

snippet: The bombing on Monday afternoon started a fire that spread quickly from one bus to another. Two of the wounded were listed in serious condition, the authorities said....
abstract: About 21 people are injured after bomb explodes on bus in Jerusalem; police are trying to determine whether blast was act of terrorism, crime, or result of mechanical flaw.
lead_paragraph: The bombing on Monday afternoon started a fire that spread quickly from one bus to another. Two of the wounded were listed in serious condition, the authorities said.

byline.contributor: Majd Al Waheidi contributed reporting from Gaza, and Diaa Hadid from Jaffa, Israel.

snippet: Officials on Saturday confirmed the deaths of Justin and Stephanie Shults, a couple who had settled in Belgium....
lead_paragraph: Officials on Saturday confirmed the deaths of Justin and Stephanie Shults, a couple who had settled in Belgium.

headline.print_headline: Belgian Brothers Named in Attacks; 3rd Man Is Hunted
headline.main: Brothers Among 3 Brussels Suicide Attackers; Another Assailant Is Sought

snippet: Ibrahim el-Bakraoui attacked the airport and his brother Khalid attacked the subway, Belgian officials said, as an inquiry drew links to the 2015 Paris attacks....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Belgian authorities identify suicide bombers in terrorist attacks as Belgium-born brothers Ibrahim and Khalidel-Bakraoui, both of whom had violent criminal histories; Turkish authorities say one of brothers was deported in 2015 on suspicion of being terrorist linked to Islamic State group, but Belgian authorities say neither brother was suspected of links to terrorist group until recently.
lead_paragraph: Ibrahim el-Bakraoui attacked the airport and his brother Khalid attacked the subway, Belgian officials said, as an inquiry drew links to the 2015 Paris attacks.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by C. J. Chivers from the United States; Dan Bilefsky and James Kanter from Brussels; Lilia Blaise and Benoît Morenne from Paris; Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul; and Rukmini Callimachi and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN, KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA and AURELIEN BREEDEN

headline.print_headline: Winding Investigation of Jewish Center Bombing Takes New Turn
headline.main: Twisting Inquiry Into Buenos Aires Bombing Takes New Turn

snippet: Argentina’s new government has vowed to get to the bottom of a 1994 attack on a Jewish center that killed 85 people and led to a lasting rift with Iran....
abstract: Memo from Argentina; Pres Mauricio Macri will introduce legislation to try suspects in absentia for 1994 bombing at Jewish center that killed 85 people; prosecutor Alberto Nisman, who died from gunshot wound in 2015, had argued that attack was authorized by Iranian officials and carried out by Hezbollah.
lead_paragraph: Argentina’s new government has vowed to get to the bottom of a 1994 attack on a Jewish center that killed 85 people and led to a lasting rift with Iran.
